abstract: Reader’s Digest’s decision to file for bankruptcy protection is a blemish on the generally successful record of long-time deal-maker Timothy C. Collins. For some, it also raises questions about the issue of private equity fees.
snippet: Reader’s Digest’s decision to file for bankruptcy protection is a blemish on the generally successful record of long-time deal-maker Timothy C. Collins. For some, it also raises questions about the issue of private equity fees.
lead_paragraph: In one way, the Reader’s Digest Association‘s decision to file for bankruptcy protection is just another reminder of the grim state of the media industry.

headline.main: Reader’s Digest: Reading Between the Lines
